reviewText:
Growing Pains: The Complete Sixth Season contains all 24 episodes of the shows 1990-1991 season. Mike (Kirk Cameron) and Carol (Tracey Gold) move to New York City to be roommates, an arrangement that doesnt go very well. Ben (Jeremy Miller) struggles with life lessons about the true rewards of high school vanities, and Chrissy (Ashley Johnson) has all she can do just to get noticed by her busy family.

Growing Pains was one of most successful family sit-coms of the 80s-90s era. The father, Dr. Jason Seaver (Alan Thicke), was a psychiatrist who had moved his office into his suburban New York home when wife Maggie (Joanna Kerns) went back to work, in order to keep an eye on the kids. When the show began. Mike was a young teenager more interested in having a good time than in responsibility. Carol was his brainy sister, and Ben their young brother who had a knack for getting into innocent trouble. From time to time, the show dealt with serious issues, such as drunk driving, teen suicide, racism, and peer pressure on Mike to use cocaine. Parents Jason and Maggie, like Jim and Margaret Anderson (Father Knows Best) before them, saw their kids through crises large and small.

As the series progressed and the characters developed, Mike graduated from high school, enrolled in a local college, worked odd jobs, tried acting for a while, and had one attractive girlfriend after another. He later taught remedial education, for college credit, at an inner-city school. For a time, Cameron was a teen heartthrob, his picture on the covers of countless teen magazines, who received 10,000 letters a month.

The unrated, color Season 6 episodes are available in a 3-DVD set.
Love it
Not as good as I remember but still good.
Always loved this show. I hoped Camron was gay, but he turned out to be a damn bible thumper.

No idea why the reviews aren't 100 percent across the board. This set is packed with 3 discs that have all of the very memorable episodes of the sixth season. The quality of the episodes is not half bad. It's definitely not high definition but that's the point-it's an 80s sitcom. Too good! Only one more season needs to be released and then every season is out on DVD. To make sure that happens, please by the DVD set through Amazon and not the independent sellers!

Another great season of this classic comedy but the video quality is marginally at best. Its too bad Growing Pains was never remastered for better picture quality. Still an awesome show to relive all over again!
Love the show, but the discs are something else. Has a hard time loading & if you have to stop playing it might not reload very easily. But there were no skips or anything.
Best of the best!

This is an awesome DVD. Re watching this show makes me really happy cause it was one of my all time favorite shows ever! And getting to watch my favorite actor Kirk Cameron play mike throughout the whole series just makes me smile. I am really happy with this purchase and I love this show!!
I like the show.
Very Good
I'm watching this season now!!
I always enjoyed this show when it was on the air so I was very happy to see this season released on dvd.  Now I'm waiting for season 7 to complete the set!!
good dvd
Excellent.  We grew up watching Growing Pains.  Great Show
We love Growing Pains!  Excellent DVD set
Great show with a lot of laughter

I like this TV show very much. It shows the care and love for each other in the family, and it is very fun to watch. I like this show. very much. I bought all 7 season of it

this was probably the last "good" season. i was less than thrilled with leo in the 7th season & even this one had episodes i could have done without(the 3 part europe & the 2 part halloween).
It came in excellent condition.
great show
IF you grew up with the Seavers, you will love this! it brings you back to your youth when you were 13 and in love with Mike Seaver! He was so cute!! Great show!!!
Cute show from the 90's.  This was one of my favorites to watch on Friday.
